solution.text:
Seema bought the house for Rs _{j}_ lakhs = Rs _{{j*100000}}_
She then sold it for Rs _{k}_ lakhs = Rs _{{k*100000}}_
Increase in price = _{{k*100000}}_ - _{{j*100000}}_ = Rs _{{(k-j)*100000}}_
Therefore, percentage increase = \(\frac{_{{(k-j)*100000}}_}{_{{j*100000}}_} \times 100 = _{{trunc( Decimal(100*(k-j))/Decimal(j), 2 )}}_\%% \)

content.text: Seema bought her house for Rs _{j}_ lakhs. Five years later, she sold her house for Rs _{k}_ lakhs. What was the percentage price increase?
